content: 通話での問い合わせ先がしりたい
creator: yoshidondondon

content:
Do you really mean you over 800 FOLDERS in your Sent folder - 'cause that would be very unusual and might indicate that there's something wrong - or do you mean you have over 800 MESSAGES in your Sent folder? And are you OK with losing all those messages forever?

If so, simply select them all (click on one, then press CTRL+A to select all) and then press the Delete key. They will then go into your Trash folder. You can then right-click on the Trash folder and choose Empty Trash.

If this is not what you're trying to do, please clarify and give us more details.

By the way, the Unified Folders feature will show all similar folders for multiple email accounts as one virtual folder. For example, all Inbox messages together, all Trash folders together, etc. Some people (not me) find this to be a cleaner presentation. But it's not necessary to use the feature to delete messages.
creator: rednoise

content:
This is how to adjust the fonts for viewing and composing messages:

- go to TB menu > Settings > General > Language & Fonts > Fonts > click 'Advanced' button

- at the top, set 'Fonts for:' to Latin if it isn't already

- change Proportional and Monospace fonts/sizes to your liking

- set Minimum font size to 14

- at the top, change set 'Fonts for:' to Other Writing Systems

- repeat the process of changing fonts/sizes

- at the bottom, make sure 'Allow messages to use other fonts' is disabled if desired > OK > close the popup
creator: siffemoz

content:
Are you using an Apple device? I found this long conversation that describes similar to what you describe. Only Apple device users seem to be affected. There are a number of suggested fixes, but it's not clear to me if any of them are the one true magic bullet.

https://forums.xfinity.com/conversations/email/apple-device-email-clients-not-working-with-comcastnet-accounts/6913dbb2ed2c3f53707a1ee9
creator: rednoise

content:
Hi,

I know you are frustrating about your email password in Thunderbird.

My experience is that you just start your Thunderbird with your email account. If you changed the password, it will fail to connect to your email server, and pop up to ask your credentials. You can just input your new password then.

Hope this helps.
creator: wxie2016
